Tutorials in Theoretical Chemistry

Register now!

About

Tutorials in Theoretical Chemistry

The 2016 Edition of the Tutorials in Theoretical Chemistry organized by the Université Paul Sabatier will be held in Saint-Lary-Soulan, France, from the 5th to the 13th February 2016.


These tutorials are focused in computer implementations, and numerical methods. The number of students is limited to 35.




This event is done in the frame of École des sciences avancées de Luchon the mirror web page is at http://www.quantware.ups-tlse.fr/ecoledeluchon/sessionwis2/.


Organising committee

  • Stefano Evangelisti
  • Thierry Leininger
  • Arjan Berger
  • Romuald Poteau
  • Nicolas Suaud
  • Muammar El Khatib
  • Oriana Brea



Sponsored by



Register

How to proceed?



Deadlines

Note: The maximum number of students for this edition is limited to 35. In order to be considered, please take into account the following dates:

  • Registration : before 31st October, 2015 at 23:59:59 (GMT+1).
  • Payment/Inscription: before 30th November 2015 at 23:59:59 (GMT+1).



1) Registration

Use the registration form to request your inscription to the tutorials. For general inquiries please use the contact form.

2) Payment/Inscription

If you are accepted, you will get an email with instructions to pay the inscription fees (100€).

3) Confirmation

You have to send us back the payment invoice, and once we receive it your participation is confirmed.




Note: Registration fees cover: teaching, meals, accommodation, and travel from Toulouse Blagnac to Saint-Lary-Soulan.

Venue

Centre de Vacances Le Néouvielle

The tutorials will take place in the Centre de Vacances Le Néouvielle that is located in Saint-Lary in Hautes-Pyrénées 80 km south of the département's capital Tarbes, next to the Le Néouvielle Nature Reserve and the Pyrenees National Park and is a 20 minute drive to Spain.



Ski Saint-Lary-Soulan 2015 - GoPro from Mark LUCAS on Vimeo.



Important dates

We will meet at Blagnac Airport on 5th February at 16:00 (GMT+1). A bus will take us roundtrip from the airport to the venue as shown below:

  • Toulouse - Saint-Lary-Soulan : Departure from Blagnac airport on 5th February, 2016 at 17:00 (GMT+1).
  • Saint-Lary Soulan - Toulouse: Arrival on 13th February 2016 at 11:00 (GMT+1).

Program

TCCM Winter Tutorial Computational Tools for Theoretical Chemistry 2016

Topics

  • APT: Advanced programming techniques. (T. Leininger)
  • BNP: Geometry and Topology - Building Nanoparticles. (R. Poteau)
  • LDCS: Low-dimensional Carbon structures - the usefulness of simple approaches. (S. Evangelisti)
  • QM: Quantum Magnetism - the Heisenberg model. (N. Suaud)
  • QD: Quantum Dynamics. (A. Berger)




Teachers

  • Arjan Berger (LCPQ)
  • Lucy Cusinato (LPCNO)
  • Muammar El Khatib (LCPQ)
  • Stefano Evangelisti (LCPQ)
  • Thierry Leininger (LCPQ)
  • Romuald Poteau (LPCNO)
  • Nicolas Suaud (LCPQ)




  • LCPQ: Laboratoire de Chimique et Physique Quantiques; Université Paul Sabatier - Toulouse.
  • LPCNO: Laboratoire de Physique et Chimique des Nano-Objets; Université Paul Sabatier et INSA - Toulouse.

Activities

Saint-Lary is a lively holiday destination that attracts hikers, spa-goers, skiers, white water sports enthusiasts, mountain-bikers and bicycle tourists throughout the year.

  • Client: LTTC
  • Date:
  • Service: winter

Le Néouvielle

At the heart of the Aure valley, the holiday resort is located in Saint-Lary. This authentic Pyrenean village with a friendly atmosphere is a climatic health resort sought, near Spain.

  • Client:
  • Date: April 2014
  • Service: winter

natural sites

Saint-Lary-Soulan is one of the largest ski resorts in the French Pyrenees with over 100 km of downhill slopes. There are 53 pistes spread over three linked, and yet distinct sectors. Saint Lary 1700 is known as the Pla d'Adet sector and provides family skiing including snow kindergarten, toboggan run and a 'Kidpark', a snowpark aimed at young skiers aged between 6 and 12 years. Saint Lary 1900 is known as the Espiaube sector and is frequented by more experienced skiers. The showpiece ski run is the Mirabelle which descends 700 metres over its 3.6 km (2.2 mi) length. Saint Lary 2400 has a snowpark which doubles as a skate park in the summer, mogul and slalom stadiums and also provides access to Lake Oule for snow-shoeing.

  • Client: LTTC
  • Date: April 2014
  • Service: winter
